page.title: 05FAIRFORD HOSPITAL
page.content: {Fairford Cottage Hospital}is Gloucestershire's smallest hospital. There was a Rural Hospital in cottages in Park Street from l867 - l887, and the building of the Cottage Hospital in The Croft marked{Queen Victoria's {Golden Jubilee.} Originally of 8 beds, the hospital once had its own operating theatre. Extensions and modernisation have increased the size and scope of the hospital to l5 beds, a casualty treatment room, and Day Hospital facilities to which some 24 patients are brought in each week from their homes for physiotherapy and medical treatment. The hospital is on a single ground floor plan and is the only substantial red-brick building in this Cotswold stone town.
